definition: to come close/to get near to/front
front/forward/ahead/first/top (followed by a number)/future/ago/before/BC (e.g. 前293年)/former/formerly

sentences.english: When the female soldier came around, she stopped her.
sentences.chinese: 當那個女士兵走到了茱莉亞的近前，阻止茱莉亞。

sentences.english: Then they sat down near the fire.
sentences.chinese: 然後她們在火的近前坐下來。

sentences.english: At this moment, the tiger has already arrived near.
sentences.chinese: 這時，老虎已經衝到了近前。

sentences.english: She was now seen by many young men who had not been near her before.
sentences.chinese: 許多原來不在她近前的年輕人，現在看見她了。

sentences.english: Peony no time to open the season, conditions are near to Mo autumn.
sentences.chinese: 牡丹未及開時節，況是秋風莫近前。

sentences.english: Maybe you'll sit and sigh, wishing that I was near.
sentences.chinese: 也許你坐倒嘆息，希望我在近前。

sentences.english: But when it got very close it changed into the shape of a man.
sentences.chinese: 但當它走到近前是，它變成了人性。

definition: (of children, parents etc) at one's side/living with one
the front (of)/(in) front/(in) sb's presence/just before (a date)
(idiom) no sooner said than done/before you know it
pinyin: shuo1 shi2 chi2 , na4 shi2 kuai4

definition: to lean forward/to lean out (of a window, door etc)
